column4: UPDATE 3-Microsoft Surface sales sink  shares dip
column5: April 27 Microsoft Corp slightly missed Wall Street's average revenue estimate for the latest quarter on Thursday  as sales of its Surface tablets and laptops slumped in the face of revamped competition in the personal computer market.

column4: BRIEF-Microsoft sees Q4 intelligent cloud revenue $7.2 bln - $7.4 bln
column5: * Microsoft sees Q4 intelligent cloud revenue $7.2 billion - $7.4 billion
* Qtrly revenue was $22.1 billion GAAP  and $23.6 billion non-GAAP
Microsoft Corp  reported a 27.8 percent increase in quarterly profit on Thursday  lifted by robust demand for its cloud computing services.

column4: Options bulls gun for more as U.S. tech earnings roll up
column5: NEW YORK Options traders are betting that the U.S. technology sector's strong rally has more room to run as big industry names Microsoft Corp  Intel Inc and Google parent Alphabet Inc get set to report quarterly results.

column4: Options bulls gun for more as U.S. tech earnings roll up
column5: NEW YORK  April 27 Options traders are betting that the U.S. technology sector's strong rally has more room to run as big industry names Microsoft Corp  Intel Inc and Google parent Alphabet Inc get set to report quarterly results.

column4: Intel's revenue misses estimates as data center growth slows
column5: Intel Corp reported lower-than-expected quarterly revenue due to an unexpected slowdown in growth at its data center business  on which the world's largest chipmaker is banking to reduce its reliance on the personal computer market.

column4: UPDATE 4-Intel's revenue misses estimates as data center growth slows
column5: * Shares fall nearly 4 pct after the bell (Adds details from conference call)

column4: BRIEF-Intel posts Q1 non-GAAP profit of 66 cents/share
column5: * First-quarter revenue of $14.8 billion  up 8 percent year-over-year on a GAAP basis

column4: BRIEF-Intel sees FY 2017 non-GAAP earnings $2.85/share  +/- 5 pct
column5: * Qtrly client computing group revenue of $8.0 billion  up 6 percent
April 27 Intel Corp  the world's largest chipmaker  reported a near 45 percent rise in first-quarter profit  helped by strength in its data center business and a stabilizing personal computer market.
